Cyclone sim: 16:30 UTC friday Cyclone Trina Cat 4 is currently 80 nautical miles from Samoa at NNW -13, -173 moving at 10 mph.
Preparations are underway for imminent landstrike. 
The National Emergency Operations Centre is being activated in advance of official notification and requests for help are coming in via phonecall and sms. 
Initial requests are for trees to be cleared in case of falling onto houses and ropes to tie roofs down.

Cyclone sim: 18:45 UTC Cyclone Trina now gusting up to 240km/h calssified as severe tropical cyclone. positioned 35 nautical miles off the coast of Savaii at -13.14, -173.15 and moving at 15 miles per hour towards the north western side of Savaii. Expected landstrike in under 3 hours. Emergency services are assisting evacuations of disabled and elderly from the coast. Trina is classified as life threatening. People are advised to get to the safest location they can and secure shelter for their animals. Food stores and water supplies, spare clothing, and blankets

properties.incident title: Ambulance assistance and evacuation offered to seriously injured in Aleipata and Fagaloa
properties.description:
Ambulance - 2 from Fire Service, 2 from NHS are available on Upolu already making their way using cross island road to pick up seiously injured from Aleipata and Fagaloa




Justine Mackinnon
JusMack Consulting Ltd

jus@jusmack.com
http://about.me/jusmack
Twitter: @fidget02


07747787873

All EPC (Electric Power Corporation) and SWA (Samoa Water AUthority) vehicles in the affected areas have been directed to pick the injured, District hospitals in Lalomanu, Poutasi and Lufilufi (on Upolu) are now open to treat less serious injuries, got 2 doctors per district hospital, and 3 nurses each,


Justine Mackinnon
JusMack Consulting Ltd

jus@jusmack.com
